Brownfield land

View the data

Explore the brownfield land data on this page, which has been collected and processed by the Digital Land pipeline.

URL of the register:
https://www.northumberland.gov.uk/NorthumberlandCountyCouncil/media/Planning-and-Building/planning%20policy/Studies%20and%20Evidence%20Reports/Housing%20Studies/7.%20Brownfield/Northumberland-Brownfield-Land-Register-December-2019-CSV.csv
Published 30 December 2019
Last collected on 21 December 2020
From:
Northumberland County Council

How we've processed this data

The Digital Land pipeline collects the data and fixes common errors that do not align with the data standard.

You can download the data as it was collected, after it has been harmonised (CSV) to meet the data standard, and transformed (CSV) into the Digital Land data model.

Related content

  • Brownfield land data standard
  • Brownfield land register regulations (2017)

Facts from the data

The following information has been extracted from the register.

The register references 1 organisation.

It reports 254 brownfield sites. 20 of these have an end date and are no longer considered brownfield land.

Not including sites with an end date, there are:

  • 409.50 hectares of brownfield land
  • between 6275 and 6729 potential dwellings that could be built
  • 0 sites have permission in principle
